contentfulPagePressRelease.title: International Workshops to Bring Qatar and UK Researchers Together

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Qatar National Research Fund (QNRF) in partnership with the British Council Qatar, the UK Science and Innovation Network (SIN), and the UK Department for Business, Innovation and Skills (BIS), has announced six joint research workshops under the Qatar–UK Research Networking Programme (Q-UKRNP).

The scheme will provide an opportunity for up to 120 early career researchers from Qatar to meet and form connections with their UK counterparts. The program will also help solidify sustainable, international links with the higher education sectors of each country.

The six workshops, due to start in March, are aligned with Qatar Foundation for Education, Science and Community Development’s (QF) mandate to drive the development of human capital in the country, while unlocking human potential and fostering a progressive society.

Dr. Abdul Sattar Al-Taie, Executive Director, QNRF, said: “Since its inception, QNRF has recognized the importance of international collaborations. These upcoming workshops are an excellent opportunity for researchers, from both Qatar and the UK, to stay connected and exchange information and ideas that will lead to mutually beneficial developments in the future. At QNRF, we are all looking forward to seeing the outstanding output and outcomes generated as a result of this program."

Each workshop will focus on a thematic area of academia, relevant to Qatar’s national research priorities. This includes: ‘Entrepreneurship 2020’, ‘Empowering Connected Health In Qatar Using Intelligent Medical Devices And IoT’, ‘Sustainable Materials And Materials For Sustainability’, ‘Big Data Management’, ‘Challenges In Speech And Language Processing For Multi-Genre Broadcasts’, ‘CNS Tumours In Children’, and ‘Adolescents And Young Adults: From Bench To Bedside And Beyond’.

For the full story, please click here.
